Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent of the U.S. trade deficit under Trump by stating it is at an "all-time high" when it is not.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that the trade deficit is at an all-time high under Trump.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that a high trade deficit is inherently negative without considering other factors or alternative explanations.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that trade deficits were higher during the Bush administration than they have been under Trump.
Understate: The claim understates the trade deficit levels during the Obama/Biden administration by not acknowledging that they were also relatively high.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the trade deficit, such as global economic factors or changes in trade policies.
